text:
MELCOLM RUFFIN: Growing
up, my family is always
really close and tight-knit.
I was the sports junkie.

My family called me
the walking ESPN.

I knew every player stats,
hometown, college, height.

It was kind of my way of
being around my uncles
and my dad and my brothers.

That was my way of being a part
of the grown up conversations.

When I was a teenager, I
was flipping through ESPN,
the magazine, as I often did.

One day, there was an article
on sports management programs
as a major in college.

For me, it seemed like
a dream come true,

that I can make a
career in this, even

though I wasn't quite good
enough to make it on the court.

And so that moment
changed my life.

After UMass Amherst,
I was fortunate enough

to get into a rotational program
at the NBA League headquarters.

I went on to work primarily
with the NBA Development League.

I was working across sponsorship
and social media and all
these different areas.

I really learned that I could
influence at a higher level,

to be in boardrooms and in
meetings with executives.

It really changed my lens on
what my full potential was.

And when it came time to
apply to business school,
HBS had always been on my radar.

I really felt that there was so
many benefits to being at HBS

whether it's the network,
whether it's the case method,

the section experiences
are all things

that are iconic and
only here at HBS.

And it really made
my choice very clear.

My favorite part of
the HBS experience

has definitely been the
African-American Student Union.

My role with ASU
is co-president.

Our goals are to have the
Black community really thrive.

We want to build
platforms for people

to come together and
have a good time,

but also have a really
great support system.

We give them advice
on the things

that we wish we
would have known,

whether that's housing and
dispelling the myths on travel.

At HBS, those are some
of the initiatives
that we're putting in place.

After HBS, I hope to continue
down a path beyond just sports

and to really decide if
that is the industry that's
best suited for me.

I want to continue to
experiment and ideate

to decide where I can really
maximize my potential.
